name: Effortless Rustic Bread
author: amyw
summary: This is the easiest recipe for rustic bread I've ever seen. Luckily it is also the yummiest. Feel free to halve the recipe if you only want one loaf, but beware: it's so addictive you may wish you'd just baked both loaves.
directions: Mix water, yeast, and salt together in a large bowl until mixture becomes foamy, about 10 minutes
Stir flour into yeast mixture until well incorporated
The dough will be loose and look wet
Cover bowl loosely with a damp towel and let sit for about 5 hours
Shape dough into 2 loaves using damp hands
Place loaves on a cornmeal-dusted work surface and score the tops a few times with a sharp knife
Allow loaves to double in size, 30 to 60 minutes
Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C)
Place loaves on a baking sheet
Bake in the preheated oven, spraying the surface of the dough occasionally with water, until golden brown, about 20 minutes
